0:["SaSKGtlS57LyI0bTyFZDN",[[["",{"children":["usage-notes",{"children":["__PAGE__",{}]}]},"$undefined","$undefined",true],["",{"children":["usage-notes",{"children":["__PAGE__",{},[["$L1",[["$","header",null,{"className":"mb-8","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"container mx-auto","children":[["$","nav",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between p-4","children":[["$","$L2",null,{"href":"/","className":"flex items-center space-x-2","children":["$","$L3",null,{"src":"../logo_small.png","alt":"K-Alpha Logo","width":150,"height":30}]}],["$","$L2",null,{"href":"/usage-notes","className":"text-blue-600 hover:underline","children":"Usage Notes"}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"border-t border-gray-200","children":["$","h1",null,{"className":"text-2xl sm:text-3xl font-bold text-center py-4 my-8","children":"Usage notes"}]}]]}]}],["$","main",null,{"className":"container mx-auto py-8 px-4","children":[["$","section",null,{"className":"mb-8","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"text-xl font-semibold mb-4","children":"Data File Structure for K-Alpha Calculator"}],["$","h4",null,{"className":"text-lg font-medium mb-2","children":"Format Specifications"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"mb-4","children":"The data file should adhere to the following specifications:"}],["$","ul",null,{"className":"list-disc pl-6 mb-4 space-y-2","children":[["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"File Type:"}]," The file must be in a .csv (Comma-Separated Values) format."," ",["$","strong",null,{"children":"The separator must be a comma (,) or a semicolon (;). Tab or other separators are not allowed."}]]}],["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"Layout and Content:"}]," Data should be organized in a matrix format where:",["$","ul",null,{"className":"list-disc pl-6 mt-2 space-y-1","children":[["$","li",null,{"children":"Rows represent individual items rated."}],["$","li",null,{"children":"Columns correspond to the raters providing the codes."}],["$","li",null,{"children":["$","strong",null,{"children":"Rate values must be represented numerically. Decimals are not allowed."}]}],["$","li",null,{"children":"Data should be nominal, ordinal, interval, or ratio."}],["$","li",null,{"children":["'NA' (without quotation marks) represents a missing value."," ",["$","strong",null,{"children":"Empty cells are not allowed."}]]}],["$","li",null,{"children":"The file should not contain any headers, footers, or empty spaces."}],["$","li",null,{"children":"Not include the names of the items or the names of the raters."}],["$","li",null,{"children":"Only one data file can be uploaded at a time; it must not exceed 500KB."}]]}]]}]]}]]}],["$","section",null,{"className":"mb-8","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"text-xl font-semibold mb-4","children":"Example Structure"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"mb-4","children":"Consider a scenario with 5 items, 4 raters, and 3 categories represented by the values 1, 2, 3 (nominal data). The data file should comprise 5 rows (one for each item) and 4 columns (one for each rater). The cell values denote the rates assigned. An example representation is as follows:"}],["$","pre",null,{"className":"bg-gray-200 p-4 rounded-md mb-4","children":["1,1,1,1","\n","2,2,3,2","\n","3,3,3,3","\n","3,3,3,3","\n","2,2,2,2"]}]]}],["$","section",null,{"className":"mb-8","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"text-xl font-semibold mb-4","children":"Missing Values"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"mb-4","children":"When a rater has not assigned a rate to an item, the corresponding cell should be marked as 'NA' (without quotation marks). For example, if rater 3 did not assign a rate to item 1 and rater 2 did not assign a rate to item 4, the data file should appear as follows:"}],["$","pre",null,{"className":"bg-gray-200 p-4 rounded-md mb-4","children":["1,1,NA,1","\n","2,2,3,2","\n","3,3,3,3","\n","3,NA,3,3","\n","2,2,2,2"]}]]}],["$","section",null,{"className":"mb-8","children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"text-xl font-semibold mb-4","children":"Sample Data Files"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"mb-4","children":["Both files reflect a scenario with 12 items, 4 raters, 5 categories represented by the values 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 (nominal data), and several missing values with NA codes. The sample data files below report the exemplary calculations provided by"," ",["$","a",null,{"href":"https://doi.org/10.4135/9781071878781","className":"text-blue-600 hover:underline","target":"_blank","rel":"noopener noreferrer","children":"Krippendorff"}]," ","(2019, p. 304)."]}],["$","ul",null,{"className":"list-disc pl-6 mb-4 space-y-2","children":[["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"CSV File:"}]," This file represents the data structure without headers. You can download it here:"," ",["$","a",null,{"href":"/rating_data_sample.csv","className":"text-blue-600 hover:underline","children":"rating_data_sample.csv"}]]}],["$","li",null,{"children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"XLSX File:"}]," This version includes headers with raters' and items' names for clarity, which is particularly useful when viewing in spreadsheet software. You can download it here:"," ",["$","a",null,{"href":"/rating_data_sample.xlsx","className":"text-blue-600 hover:underline","children":"rating_data_sample.xlsx"}]]}]]}],["$","p",null,{"className":"font-bold mb-4","children":"IMPORTANT: The XLSX files should be exported from the spreadsheet software in .csv format, removing the headers (the first row in the file) and the first column with the items' names before saving. Also, check that the exported file uses a comma (,) or a semicolon (;) as the separator. Tab or other separators are not allowed."}]]}],["$","section",null,{"children":[["$","h3",null,{"className":"text-xl font-semibold mb-4","children":"Data Privacy"}],["$","p",null,{"children":"As the authors and maintainers of the K-Alpha Calculator, we are committed to preserving high standards of ethical conduct in data management and user privacy. We assure users that all data input into the K-Alpha Calculator remains exclusively within the user's domain, as this calculator operates entirely on the user's local machine. This guarantees that no data is retained, stored, or transmitted to external servers or storage systems."}]]}]]}],["$","footer",null,{"className":"container mx-auto px-4 py-6 my-6","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"text-sm text-gray-600 text-center","children":[["$","p",null,{"className":"mb-2","children":[["$","strong",null,{"children":"To Cite K-Alpha Calculator:"}]," Marzi, G., Balzano, M., & Marchiori, D. (2024). K-Alpha Calculatorâ€”Krippendorff's Alpha Calculator: A User-Friendly Tool for Computing Krippendorff's Alpha Inter-Rater Reliability Coefficient.
